snippet: Those who emerged after the methodical assault at the Inland Regional Center recall a mix of training and holiday celebrating suddenly gone wrong.
abstract: Witnesses to mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif, describe scene of carnage, chaos and fear; attendees at conference where attack occurred were multicultural group representing area's diversity; several recount scrambling for safety of hiding places and uncertainty over whether they would survive.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, JENNIFER MEDINA, IAN LOVETT and JULIE TURKEWITZ
byline.contributor: Rick Rojas and Rebecca Fairley Raney contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Those who emerged after the methodical assault at the Inland Regional Center recall a mix of training and holiday celebrating suddenly gone wrong.

headline.main: For San Bernardino Survivors, a Day of Screams and Chaos
headline.print_headline: As Bullets Flew, Urgent Prayers and Pure Panic
